description: Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 2 (approved drawings) of planning permission ref: 213518FUL dated 01/07/2021 for: Construction of a single storey ground floor rear extension to existing commercial unit and installation of chimney flue following demolition of existing outbuildings; construction of a first floor rear extension to enable conversion of existing first floor flat from a 1x1 bed to 1x2 bed flat with rear roof terrace; and construction of second floor to create a self-contained unit, with rear roof terrace; alteration to external elevations, with associated cycle and refuse storage. Amendment seeks to omitted ground floor and first floor extensions
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (213518FUL).

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing number(s): SMR-AJ-PS03-3 (Floor Plans Existing); SMR-AJ-PS04-3 (Elevation Existing); SMR-AJ-PS05-3 (East Elevations (rear) & Section A-A Existing);  SMR-AJ-PS06-3 (Ground Floor & First Floor Plans Proposed); SMR-AJ-PS07-3 (Second Floor & Roof Floor Proposed); SMR-AJ-PS08-3 (Section A-A & B-B Proposed); SMR-AJ-PS09-3 (Elevation Proposed); SMR-AJ-PS10-3 (East Elevation (rear) Proposed); SMR-AJ-PS11-3 (Ground Floor & First Floor Plans Proposed Variation); SMR-AJ-PS12-3 (Second Floor & Roof Floor Proposed Variation); SMR-AJ-PS13-3 (Section A-A & B-B Proposed Variation); SMR-AJ-PS14-3 (Elevation Proposed Variation); SMR-AJ-PS15-3 (East Elevation (rear) Proposed Variation).

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3, D4 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to occupation of the new unit, the existing outbuildings within the rear garden shall be demolished.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1, D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The proposed rooflight hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3, D4 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to commencement of the development, a noise assessment shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise levels from transport and industrial/ commercial/ cultural sources, having regard to the assessment standards of the Council's SPG10 including aircraft noise (worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise) to achieve internal noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Best practicable mitigation measures shall also be implemented, as necessary, in external amenity spaces to achieve noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Ealing interim SPG10. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation of at least 10/15/20dB above the Building Regulations value for residential use, as necessary, of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the commercial use from dwellings. Where noise emissions from the commercia use include characteristic features, the Noise Rating level shall not exceed NR25 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside a bedroom and NR30 Leq 5mins (octaves) inside a living room. Details of mitigation measures shall include the installation method, materials of separating structures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound/rating level. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy D6 of The London Plan (2021) and Standard 30 of the London Housing SPG (2016) | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in- and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures as appropriate. The measures shall ensure that the external rating noise level LAeq emitted will be lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. A post installation sound assessment shall be carried out where required to confirm compliance with the noise criteria and additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 1.1(j) and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works in case of emergencies or complaints.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy T7 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan. | The proposed sedum roof shall be implemented in full as shown on the approved plans prior to the occupation of the new unit and shall be retained thereafter.

Any planting that within a period of five years after implementation is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity and biodiversity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 and of the London Plan (2021), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | At least three (3) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2. | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until suitable refuse and recycling storage, as indicated in the approved plans, has been provided and made available for use with capacity in compliance with BS5906:2005, and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
